summary: The "Bringing Executive Accountability, Clarity, and Oversight Now Act" (BEACON Act) amends the Inspector General Act of 1978 to establish an Office of Inspector General within the Executive Office of the President. The bill details the appointment process, outlines special provisions regarding audits, investigations, and subpoenas, and mandates semiannual reports. It also requires an audit of the new Inspector General's office and two evaluations regarding over-classification of information within the Executive Office of the President.
